policies.title: Management of Technical Vulnerabilities
policies.policy_text: The organization shall establish and maintain a technical vulnerability management process to identify, evaluate, and remediate vulnerabilities in information systems. Vulnerability information must be obtained from multiple sources including security advisories, vendor notifications, and automated scanning. All systems must be regularly assessed for vulnerabilities using industry-standard tools. Identified vulnerabilities must be classified according to risk level considering exploitability, business impact, and exposure. Remediation must be prioritized based on risk assessment results. Emergency patches must be applied within defined timeframes for critical vulnerabilities. A remediation tracking system must monitor progress and escalate overdue items. Post-remediation testing must verify successful mitigation without introducing new issues.

policies.title: Information Access Restriction
policies.policy_text: The organization shall restrict access to sensitive information and systems based on need-to-know principle. Access control mechanisms must be implemented to prevent unauthorized access. Role-based access control must be enforced. User authentication must be secure. Session management must be implemented to prevent session hijacking. Input validation must be performed to prevent injection attacks.

policies.title: Web Filtering
policies.policy_text: The organization shall implement web filtering to protect against web-based threats. Web applications must undergo security testing including automated scanning and manual penetration testing. Input validation must be implemented on all user inputs to prevent injection attacks. Output encoding must prevent cross-site scripting. Content Security Policy headers must restrict resource loading.

policies.title: Application Security Requirements
policies.policy_text: The organization shall define and implement security requirements throughout the application development lifecycle. Security requirements must be elicited during design phase. Threat modeling must identify potential attack vectors. Secure architecture review must validate security controls. All code must undergo static analysis to detect security flaws.

policies.title: Information Security for Use of Cloud Services
policies.policy_text: The organization shall establish security requirements for cloud services and verify compliance. All cloud deployments must undergo security assessment. Container images must be scanned for vulnerabilities before deployment. Cloud infrastructure must implement security hardening based on CIS benchmarks.
